title: Vuillard's Room at the Château des Clayes

thumbnail.alt_text: A work made of distemper on paper, mounted on canvas.

medium_display: Distemper on paper, mounted on canvas
credit_line: Gift of Mary and Leigh Block
publication_history:
The Art Institute of Chicago Annual report 1972-73, p. 29, pl. 17.

Émilie Daniel, Vuillard, l'espace de l'intimité, doctorate diss., Paris, Institut d'Art et d'Archéologie, 1984, pp. 417, 419, fig. 148.

Belinda Thomson, Vuillard, Oxford, Phaidon Press, 1988, pp. 150, 140, pl. 129.

Ann Dumas, “A la recherche de Vuillard,” Vuillard, Paris, Flammarion, 1990, p. 96 (ill.).

Guy Cogeval, Vuillard. Le temps détourné, Découvertes (ser.) no. 178, Paris, Gallimard and RMN, 1993, p. 103.

Antoine Salomon and Guy Congeval, Edouard Vuillard: The Inexhaustible Glance: Critical Catalogue of Paintings and Pastels vol. 3, Milan, Skira, 2003, no. XII-255.

Stephan Brown, "An Artist, His Patrons, and the Muses", Edouard Vuillard: A Painter and His Muses, 1890-1940, Exh. cat. The Jewish Museum, 2012, p. 68.
exhibition_history:
Paris, Musée des Arts Décoratifs, É. Vuillard, May-July 1938, no. 210 (as Aux Clayes. Intérieur avec une cheminée et une table bleue, c. 1935).

Ghent, Museum voor Schone Kunsten, Gentse Verzamelingen, March-May, 1953. 

Paris, Musée National d'Art Moderne, L'École de Paris dans les collections belges, July-October 1959, no. 168.

London, Marlborough Fine Art, A Tribute to Paul Maze, the Painter and his Time, May 1967, no. 121. 

New York, Marlborough Fine Art, Master of the 20th Century, 1971, no. 85.

New York, The Jewish Museum, Edouard Vuillard: A Painter and His Muses, 1890-1940. May 4-September 23, 2012.
provenance_text: Émile Laffargue, Paris, c. 1938. Roland Leten, Ghent (Belgium), by 1953 [label on verso].  Marlborough Fine Art Limited, London, 1967.  Mary and Leigh Block, Chicago, by 1973.  Gift to the Art Institute, 1973.
copyright_notice: © 2018 Artists Rights Society (ARS), New York / ADAGP, Paris

input: Vuillard's Room at the Château des Clayes
